techs.name: Home Star
techs.quote: The Sun is the star at the center of the Solar System. It is a massive, hot ball of plasma, inflated and heated by energy produced by nuclear fusion reactions at its core. Part of this internal energy is emitted from its surface as light, ultraviolet, and infrared radiation, providing most of the energy for life on Earth.

techs.name: Planet Earth
techs.quote: This is the planet we live on. Although it is still a ball of magma, it has already met the miraculous conditions for growing life.

civilopediaText.text: This is the planet we live on. Although it is still a ball of magma, it has already met the miraculous conditions for growing life.

techs.name: Primordial Soup
techs.quote: The primitive Earth's surface layers, carbon, hydrogen, water vapour, and ammonia reacted to form the first organic compounds.

civilopediaText.text: The primitive Earth's surface layers, carbon, hydrogen, water vapour, and ammonia reacted to form the first organic compounds.

techs.name: Moon
techs.quote: The moon causes the tides. This is important because it relates to changes in sea level and fluid flow, but there are still many mysteries about how the moon was born. In many cases, it is said that it was created by the impact of a giant meteorite, and that it separated from the earth, but there is also a theory that it was created by the Sumerians.

civilopediaText.text: The moon gravitationalfield causes the Earth tides. This is important because it relates to changes in sea level and fluid flow, but there are still many mysteries about how the moon was born. In many cases, it is said that it was created by the impact of a giant meteorite, and that it separated from the earth, but there is also a theory that it was created by the Sumerians.

techs.name: Amino Acid
techs.quote: Amino acids are not creature, but they make up proteins that are important to creature.

civilopediaText.text: Amino acids are not creature, but they make up proteins that are important to creature.

techs.name: Nucleotides
techs.quote: Nucleotides are organic molecules composed of a nitrogenous base, a pentose sugar and a phosphate.

civilopediaText.text: Nucleotides are organic molecules composed of a nitrogenous base, a pentose sugar and a phosphate.

techs.name: Protein
techs.quote: Proteins are large biomolecules and macromolecules that comprise one or more long chains of amino acid residues. Proteins perform a vast array of functions within organisms, including catalysing metabolic reactions, DNA replication, responding to stimuli, providing structure to cells and organisms, and transporting molecules from one location to another.

civilopediaText.text: Proteins are large biomolecules and macromolecules that comprise one or more long chains of amino acid residues. Proteins perform a vast array of functions within organisms, including catalysing metabolic reactions, DNA replication, responding to stimuli, providing structure to cells and organisms, and transporting molecules from one location to another.

techs.name: DNA
techs.quote: The DNA is Deoxyribonucleic acid.DNA is a long polymer made from repeating units called nucleotides.

civilopediaText.text: The DNA is Deoxyribonucleic acid.DNA is a long polymer made from repeating units called nucleotides.

techs.name: Proteobacteria
techs.quote: 'A mitochondrion (mitochondria) is an organelle found in the cells of most eukaryotes, such as animals, plants and fungi. Mitochondria have a double membrane structure and use aerobic respiration to generate adenosine triphosphate (ATP), which is used throughout the cell as a source of chemical energy.' - Wikipedia

techs.name: Mitosis
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Gold]

techs.name: Eukaryota
techs.quote: 'You can find microbes everywhere - they are extremely adaptable to conditions, and survive wherever they are.' -Charles Q. Choi

techs.name: Asexual Reproduction
uniques: Production to [Gold] conversion in cities changed by [+10]%

techs.name: Sexual Reproduction
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Science]
[+1 Science] from every specialist [in all cities]

civilopediaText.text: Sexual Reproduction started from 1.2 Billion Years Ago

techs.name: Cnidaria
techs.quote: 'Sponges, the members of the phylum Porifera, are a basal animal clade as a sister of the diploblasts. They are multicellular organisms that have bodies full of pores and channels allowing water to circulate through them, consisting of jelly-like mesohyl sandwiched between two thin layers of cells.' - Wikipedia

civilopediaText.text: Translucent, moving objects have been created from polyps that at first glance look like coral. Yes, this is our ancestor.It's cute.

techs.name: Cocoon
uniques: [5]% Food is carried over after population increases [in all cities]

techs.name: Spine
techs.quote: Vertebrate are bones that protect the spinal cord.

techs.name: Heart
techs.quote: The heart is a muscular organ in most animals. This organ pumps blood through the blood vessels of the circulatory system. The pumped blood carries oxygen and nutrients to the body, while carrying metabolic waste such as carbon dioxide to the lungs.

techs.name: Cephalization
techs.quote: Cephalization is an evolutionary trend in animals that, over many generations, the special sense organs and nerve ganglia become concentrated towards the rostral end of the body where the mouth is located, often producing an enlarged head.

techs.name: Fish
uniques: They are still jawless fishes (-25% Attack Strength) but after you discovering Jaw, their debuff will disappear

techs.name: Excretion Opening
uniques: [+1 Food] from [Saline water] tiles [in all cities]

techs.name: Gills
uniques: Comment [[Atmosphere] production from [Fishes] increases by +100% ([Oxygen] consumption does not increase)]

techs.name: Fish Egg
uniques: [+1 Food] from [Fresh water] tiles [in all cities]
[5]% Food is carried over after population increases [in all cities]

techs.name: Legs
techs.quote: Fins were not needed on land, so they evolved into legs. As evidence of this, the skeletons of the legs and fins have deep homology.

techs.name: Medulla Oblongata
techs.quote: medulla oblongata is anterior and partially inferior to the cerebellum. It is a cone-shaped neuronal mass responsible for autonomic (involuntary) functions, ranging from vomiting to sneezing.

techs.name: Lungfish
techs.quote: Some fish gradually adapted to living on land by changing their fins to crawl on the dried ground. The reason for this is that early terrestrial life had no enemies there.

civilopediaText.text: Some fish gradually adapted to living on land by changing their fins to crawl on the dried ground. The reason for this is that early terrestrial life had no enemies there.

techs.name: Chondrichthyes
techs.quote: Chondrichthyes is a class of jawed fish that contains the cartilaginous fish or chondrichthyans, which all have skeletons primarily composed of cartilage.

civilopediaText.text: Chondrichthyes is a class of jawed fish that contains the cartilaginous fish or chondrichthyans, which all have skeletons primarily composed of cartilage.

techs.name: Vertebrate Landing
techs.quote: Look! One of freshwater lungfish is landing using their front flippers! It's Tiktaalik!

techs.name: Fern
techs.quote: in the late Devonian, The new plant group called fern(Polypodiopsida) was rapidly diversified and still completely dominates the terrestrial flora. also The strong roots of ferns strengthened the soil.

Ferns are taller and have stronger stems and leaves than bryophytes. These superior traits easily usurped sunlight rights from the bryophytes, allowing the bryophyte empire to transition to the next world.

techs.name: Lung
uniques: Comment [[Atmosphere] production from [Amphibian], [Reptiles], [Mammal], [Birds] increases by +100% ([Oxygen] consumption does not increase)]

techs.name: Keratinized Skin
techs.quote: Their fish-like slimy bodies are not suitable for dried ground. It has to be thicker and wilder...

techs.name: Insect
techs.quote: Once invertebrates were brought to land, they rapidly evolved at a rate unmatched by vertebrates. The secret lies in their low metabolism and high birth rate. And because the lungs are not used, the blood is not red. They account for 53% of all living creatures in terms of the number of discovered species that exist today.

techs.name: Amnion
uniques: [5]% Food is carried over after population increases [in all cities]

techs.name: Reptile
techs.quote: Life for landed lungfishes without natural enemies was inconvenient. This is because life on land is different from the underwater, with no use of fins, obstacles such as trees, fire, limited water sources, and rough terrain. And as a result of evolving to overcome this, cool reptiles are born. They will rise as rulers of the earth for a long time.

techs.name: Chorion
uniques: [5]% Food is carried over after population increases [in all cities]

techs.name: Water Tight
uniques: Enables [Embarked] units to enter ocean tiles
techs.quote: Why would you go to the water after adapt to terrestrial? ...There were too many enemies there, so you decided to escape to the water. I guess.

techs.name: Conifer
uniques: [+1 Food, +1 Production] from [Forests] tiles [in all cities]

techs.name: Egg Shell
uniques: [5]% Food is carried over after population increases [in all cities]

techs.name: Uterus
uniques: Production to [Science] conversion in cities changed by [+10]%

techs.name: Nocturnal Bottleneck
techs.quote: Mammals have evolved as nocturnal animals for 160 million years, and their legacy still remains in our anatomy. Today, mammals dominant on earth, but most of them are nocturnal.

techs.name: Placenta
uniques: Production to [Science] conversion in cities changed by [+10]%
techs.quote: Most extant mammals are placentalia. Having a placenta could protect an immature from kidnappers.

techs.name: Primate
techs.quote: Primates are animals that can climb trees and hold branch using their five opposable fingers.

techs.name: Neocortex
techs.quote: The neocortex is responsible for rational, analytical thinking and language functions. It seems that lower organisms tend to be smaller, while higher organisms tend to be larger.

techs.name: Estrus
uniques: Production to [Science] conversion in cities changed by [+10]%
techs.quote: Most extant mammals are placentalia. Having a placenta could protect an immature from kidnappers.

techs.name: Neoaves
techs.quote: After the Late Cretaceous extinction, birds diversification rapidly accelerated. Neoaves are birds that belong to the neognathic order, and 95% of existing bird species are neoaves. Also they can fly, except penguin like.

techs.name: Meadow
techs.quote: During the Miocene, rainforests were invaded by Poaceae many places(especially North America). Around this time, the forest area began to decrease, and open areas became dominated by grasslands. In addition, ungulates coevolved with grasslands and spread as prey throughout the world.

techs.name: Ape
techs.quote: The Miocene was marked by many important divergences for Primates. Great apes branched into gorillas, which further branched into human ancestors and chimpanzee ancestors. The Adam and Eve are here.

techs.name: Learning
techs.quote: The Limbic System expands area of cognition in many ways. Now, Mammal can cognitive the Sociality, Group working, Learning, Spatial memorization, and Remember from Episodes.

techs.name: Modern Ocean
techs.quote: Once upon a time, the Planet Earth was really simple. there are only one Continents there, and lives was only eating or moving. but nowaday, there are many continents, diversity of lives, and unbelievable complex of their colony sociality.

techs.name: Five Fingers
techs.quote: Great apes developed digits on their limbs to adapt to arboreal life.

techs.name: Upright Bipedal Walk
techs.quote: The Bipedalism of Ape was start from 4MYA(or hypothetically 7MYA). There are various theories as to why human ancester developed bipedal gait upright, but the main ones are that they are more energy efficient when walking, or that by growing taller they can see far away without having to climb trees is said that it is because. As a result, upright bipedalism freed up the frontal legs and helped them gathering food.

techs.name: Ape Brain
techs.quote: Apes are capable of high levels of cognition; some make tools and use them to acquire foods and for social displays, some have sophisticated hunting strategies requiring cooperation, influence and rank. they are status conscious, manipulative and capable of deception. they can recognise kin and conspecifics. they can learn to use symbols and understand aspects of human language including some relational syntax, concepts of number and numerical sequence.

techs.name: Menstruation
uniques: Production to [Science] conversion in cities changed by [+10]%
techs.quote: Most extant mammals are placentalia. Having a placenta could protect an immature from kidnappers.

techs.name: Australopithecus
techs.quote: Australopithecus was an early Hominina that originated in Africa and appears to have walked upright. The brain volume is about 500ml, which is almost the same as that of gorillas and chimpanzees.

techs.name: Opposable Thumb
techs.quote: Most primates have opposable thumbs in hand and legs. However, with bipedalism, human legs lost the ability that opposable thumbs.

techs.name: New Ability
techs.quote: The first innovations occurred with the use of stone tools. Now they understanding ranged attack glitches.

techs.name: Advanced Game
techs.quote: What began with rocks has moved on towards spear tips and arrow heads. Now They are Apex Predator

techs.name: Fire
techs.quote: The discovery of fire gave mankind a way to survive the winter, cooked meat and new weapons. Homo ergaster might also have been the earliest hominin to master control of fire.

techs.name: Homo Sapiens Sapiens
techs.quote: It's you.

techs.name: War
techs.quote: Homo Genus evolves to exhibit organized behavior. Finally, H. sapiens is capable of the organized violence like a we know. This allows for a new behavior: exclusion of others. As a result, large numbers military group of H.sapiens slaughtered family groups of H. neanderthalensis.

techs.name: Speaking
techs.quote: Language is a key stone to our thoughts. The ability to talk allows us to communicate with one another, sharing ideas, knowledge and instructions.

techs.name: Religion
uniques: Damage is ignored when determining unit Strength <for [Human] units> <after founding a Pantheon>
[+1 Faith] from [City center] tiles [in all cities]

techs.name: Agriculture
techs.quote: The technology cannot be stopped.

techs.name: Writing
techs.quote: We have become able to convey knowledge and stories without speaking.

techs.name: Animal Husbandry
techs.quote: We are in control of nature's right to give birth and die to other species.

techs.name: Navigation
techs.quote: We able to communicate across the continents and trade goods.

techs.name: Industrialization
techs.quote: We also control power. As we consume resources, society become more convenient.

techs.name: Flight
techs.quote: We can fly faster and higher than birds.

techs.name: Mass Society
techs.quote: We elect our leaders democratically. Both men and women are born with equal rights and can rebel against society.

techs.name: Plastics
techs.quote: We have versatile resources.

techs.name: Atomic Theory
techs.quote: We have the strength that even could destroy ourselves. Therefore we must be wise.

techs.name: Satellites
techs.quote: We can look down on the world from the space.

techs.name: Telecommunications
techs.quote: We can also talk across oceans.

techs.name: Future Evolution
techs.quote: Human civilization is evolving rapidly, and our quality of life has become richer than it has been in the last few thouthand years. On the other hand, human civilization faces various problems such as nuclear weapons, terrorism, chemical pollution, and global warming, and it is not surprising that if world will soon become like the world after the extinction of the dinosaurs. What does the future hold for the Anthropocene?
